translation: The king of Pārśecī and his ministers were so focused on making offerings to the Buddha and the saṃgha that they didn't have time to go to the king and visit him, and they cut off all communication about their contributions.

source_sentence: 於時大王，怪其間絕，即遣使者，往責所以。
translation: The king then blamed them for being cut off and sent an envoy to rebuke him for it.

source_sentence: 使者到已，宣王言令：『比年已來，人信俱斷，汝為人臣，何以違常？
translation: When the envoy arrived, the king declared, 'Since many years ago, people's faith has been cut off; why are you, as a minister, acting contrary to the norm?'

source_sentence: 將有異心，欲懷逆耶？』
translation: Will you have a different intention and want to harbor a rebellious thought?'

source_sentence: 時波塞奇，得大王教，自知違替，靡知所如，即往見佛，白如是事。
translation: Pārśecī then, having received the king's teaching, knew himself to be at odds with it and did not know what to expect, so he went to see the Buddha and told him about this.

source_sentence: 佛告王言：『汝勿憂慮，但還遣使以誠告言：「佛在我國，朝夕承事，是以不暇往覲大王；國內財物，供佛及僧，無有遺餘可以獻貢。」』
translation: The Buddha told the king, 'Don't worry, but return to the mission and tell it to him in all sincerity, 'The Buddha is in my country, serving me day and night, so I don't have time to visit the king; there's nothing left in my country to offer to the Buddha and the saṃgha.'

source_sentence: 波塞奇王，得佛教已，即還報使，如佛所語。
translation: After he had received the Buddha's teaching, the king of Pārśecī returned to the messenger, just as the Buddha had said.

source_sentence: 使到見王，具道其意。
translation: When the envoy arrived, he met the king and explained his intentions.

source_sentence: 大王聞之，甚懷盛怒，即合諸臣，共詳此事。
translation: When he heard this, the king was furious and gathered his ministers together to discuss the matter.

source_sentence: 諸臣皆言：『彼王慠慢，橫引道理，宜合兵眾往攻伐之。』
translation: The ministers all said, 'That king is arrogant and leads astray from the truth; it would be better to combine the troops and attack him.'

source_sentence: 王即然之，合兵躬往。
translation: The king then agreed, and he combined his troops and headed out.

source_sentence: 前軍近到，彼王乃知，心懷怖懼，急往白佛。
translation: When the previous army arrived, the king realized it, became frightened, and rushed to the Buddha to tell him about it.

source_sentence: 佛告王言：『莫用憂慮，但自往見，宣說前語。』
translation: The Buddha told the king, 'Don't be anxious; just go and see for yourself and explain what you've said.'

source_sentence: 波塞奇王，即與群臣，往到界上，見於大王，禮問畢訖，住在一面。
translation: King Pārśecī then went up to the border with his ministers, met the king, paid homage, and stayed to one side.

source_sentence: 大王責問：『汝何所恃，違慢失常，不來朝覲？』
translation: The king asked, 'What's the reason you're so arrogant and out of line and haven't come to pay your respects?'

source_sentence: 波塞奇言：『佛世難值，甚難得覩，頃來在國，化導民物，朝夕侍奉故使違替。』
translation: Pārśecī said, 'The Buddha is a rare and difficult person to meet in this world, and he's been in the country for a long time, teaching people and guiding their livelihoods, and he's been serving them day and night, so he's turned them away.'

source_sentence: 於時大王，復更重責：『正使令爾，何以斷獻？』
translation: The king then again reprimanded him, 'Why did you cut off your offering when the rightful envoy told you to do so?'

source_sentence: 波塞奇言：『佛有徒眾，名曰眾僧，戒德清淨，世良福田。
translation: Pārśvaji said, 'The Buddha has a group of disciples called the saṃgha, who are pure in moral virtue and a field of worldly merit.

source_sentence: 合國所有，常用供養，無有盈長可以為貢。』
translation: They are commonly offered up, and there's nothing large or small that they can contribute to.'

source_sentence: 曇摩留支聞此語已，告言：『且住！
translation: After hearing these words, Dharmaruci told him, 'Stop!

source_sentence: 須我見佛，見佛來還，乃問汝罪。』
translation: I must see the Buddha, and when I see him return, I'll question you about your crimes.'

source_sentence: 即與群臣，往至佛所。
translation: He then went with his ministers to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 是時如來，大眾圍遶，各悉靜然端坐入定。
translation: The Tathāgata then surrounded the whole crowd, and each of them quietly sat down and concentrated.

source_sentence: 有一比丘，入慈三昧，放金光明，如大火聚。
translation: One monk who had entered the concentration of kindness radiated a golden light like a great ball of fire.

source_sentence: 曇摩留支，遙見世尊，光明顯赫明曜踰日，大眾圍遶，如星中月，為佛作禮，問訊如法。
translation: Dhammaruṣṭhila saw the Bhagavān from a distance, his light shining brightly and shining brightly beyond the sun, and the whole crowd surrounded him like the moon among the stars, paid homage to the Buddha, and exchanged greetings according to the teaching.

source_sentence: 見此比丘，光明特顯，即白世尊：『此一比丘，入何等定，光曜乃爾？』
translation: Seeing this monk's extraordinary radiance, he said to the Bhagavān, 'What kind of concentration has this monk entered that makes his radiance so brilliant?'

source_sentence: 佛告大王：『此比丘者，入慈等定。』
translation: The Buddha told the king, 'This monk has entered the concentration of kindness and so forth.'

source_sentence: 王聞是語，倍增欽仰，言：『此慈定巍巍乃爾，我會當習此慈三昧。』
translation: Hearing those words, the king was doubly impressed and said, 'This concentration of kindness is so lofty that I will train in this concentration of kindness.'

source_sentence: 作是願已，志慕慈定，意甚柔濡，更無害心，即時請佛及比丘僧：『唯願迴神，往至大國。』
translation: After making this vow, he was so intent on loving concentration that his mind was so gentle and supple that he was no longer harmful, and he immediately invited the Buddha and the monks, saying, 'Please return to my soul and go to the great land.'

source_sentence: 佛即許可剋日當往。
translation: The Buddha then gave permission to go there on the next day.

source_sentence: 「波塞奇王，聞佛欲往至大王國，甚懷戀恨，愁悸無憀，心自念言：『若當令我是大王者，如來則當常住我國，由我小故不得自在。』
translation: "When King Pārśecī heard that the Buddha wanted to go to the great king's country, he was very much attached to it, troubled, and helpless, and he thought to himself, 'If I were a great king, the Tathāgata would always stay in my country; it's because I'm small that I can't be at ease.'

source_sentence: 念是事已，即問佛言：『諸王之中，何者最大？』
translation: After he thought this, he asked the Buddha, 'Which of the kings is the greatest?'

source_sentence: 佛告之曰：『轉輪王大。』
translation: The Buddha told him, 'The wheel-turning king is great.'

source_sentence: 波塞奇王，因自作願：『願我由來，供養佛及眾僧，持此功德，誓願將來世世常作轉輪之王。』
translation: King Pārśecī then made a vow of his own, 'May I make offerings to the Buddha and the saṃgha from now on and maintain this merit, vowing to always be the wheel-turning king in the ages to come.'

source_sentence: 如是阿難！
translation: Thus, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 爾時大王曇摩留支者，今彌勒是。
translation: "At the time, the great king Dharmaruci was now Maitreya.

source_sentence: 始於彼世，發此慈心，自此以來，常字彌勒。
translation: In that first world, he developed this kindness, and since then, he has always called himself Maitreya.

source_sentence: 彼波塞奇王，今祇陀是，乃於彼中，常作轉輪王，自是以來，世世恒作，乃至今日，功德不盡，是以今日，復求索作。」
translation: That Parseki king, who is now Gita, was always the wheel-turning king among them, and since then he has continued to do so from generation to generation, even up to the present day, with inexhaustible merit; therefore, today, he seeks to do it again."

source_sentence: 時穿珠，師聞說是已，尋發無上正真道意。
translation: After hearing this, the master who pierced the pearl disc discerned that he had aroused the intention for the unsurpassed true path.

source_sentence: 其餘會者，聞佛所說，有得須陀洹、斯陀含、阿那含、阿羅漢者，有發無上正真道意者，有得遷住不退地者，各皆敬戴，歡喜奉行。
translation: The rest of the assembly who heard what the Buddha taught, those who had attained stream entry, once-returner, non-returner, non-returner, and arhat, those who had arisen the unsurpassed true intention for enlightenment, and those who had attained the stage of nonretrogression in their abode of removal, each honored them, rejoiced, and approved.

source_sentence: （五八）二鸚鵡聞四諦品第五十一(丹本為五十八)
translation: (58) The 51st Chapter of the Four Truths Heard by Two Parrots (Danben 58)

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時佛在舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada's Park in Jeta's Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 爾時長者須達，敬信佛法，為僧檀越，一切所須，悉皆供給。
translation: At the time, the elder Sudatta, who respected and believed in the Buddha's teaching, became a donor to the saṃgha and provided for everything that was needed.

source_sentence: 時諸比丘，隨其所須，日日往來，說法教誨。
translation: The monks then came to him day by day as they needed, teaching and preaching.

source_sentence: 須達家內，有二鸚鵡：一名律提，二名賒律提；稟性黠慧，能知人語。
translation: At Sudatta's house, there were two parrots, one named Rutī and the other named Śāritī, who were intelligent by nature and could understand human speech.

source_sentence: 諸比丘往來，每先告語家內聞知，拂整敷具，歡喜迎逆。
translation: Whenever monks came to their house, they would first tell them that they had heard about them there, and they would dress themselves in robes and welcome them joyfully.

source_sentence: 是時阿難，往到其家，見鳥聰黠，愛之在心，而語之言：「欲教汝法。」
translation: Ānanda then went to their house, saw how smart and intelligent the birds were, loved them, and said, "I want to teach you the Dharma."

source_sentence: 二鳥歡喜，授四諦法，教令誦習，而說偈言：「豆佉　　三牟提耶　　尼樓陀　　末加」(晉言苦習滅道)門前有樹，二鳥聞法，喜悅誦習，飛向樹上，次第上下，經由七返，誦讀所受四諦妙法。
translation: Rejoicing, the two birds gave him the teaching of the four truths, taught him to recite it, and spoke in verse, saying, "Dukha, samudaya, niruddha, and marga" (a Jin term for the path to the cessation of suffering and accumulation). When the two birds heard the teaching, they rejoiced and recited it, flew up to the tree, went up and down in order, and went through seven rebirths, reciting the wonderful teaching of the four truths that they had received.

source_sentence: 其暮宿樹，野狸所食，緣此善心，即生四天。
translation: At sunset, they stayed in a tree fed by a wild beaver, and because of this good intention, they were born in the four heavens.

source_sentence: 尊者阿難，明日時到，著衣持鉢，入城乞食，聞二鸚鵡為狸所殺，生矜愍心，還白佛言：「須達家內，有二鸚鵡，弟子昨日，教誦四諦，其夜命終。
translation: Venerable Ānanda, when he arrived tomorrow, put on his robe and bowl and went into town to solicit alms. Hearing that two parrots had been killed by a beaver, he became compassionate and returned to the Buddha, saying, "There were two parrots at Sudatta's house that my disciple had taught to recite the Four Noble Truths yesterday and whose lives ended that night.

source_sentence: 不審識神，生處何所？
translation: Where will they be born if they don't examine the spirit of consciousness?

source_sentence: 唯願如來！
translation: Venerable Tathāgata!

source_sentence: 垂愍見示。」
translation: Please kindly see and show them."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「諦聽諦聽！
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "Listen closely, listen closely!

source_sentence: 善著心中，當為汝說，令汝歡喜。
translation: "Well-attaching your mind, I will explain this for you, making you rejoice.

source_sentence: 緣汝授法，喜心受持，命終之後，生四王天。
translation: If you give them the teaching and joyfully accept it, they'll be born in the Heaven of the Four Kings when their lives end.

source_sentence: 此閻浮提五十歲，為四王天上一日一夜，彼亦三十日為一月，十二月為一歲，彼四王天壽五百歲。」
translation: This Jambudvīpa is fifty years old, which is one day and one night in the Heaven of the Four Kings, where thirty days are a month and twelve months are a year, and where the life span of the Heaven of the Four Kings is five hundred years."

source_sentence: 阿難問佛：「於彼命終，當生何處？」
translation: Ānanda asked the Buddha, "Where will he be born at the end of his life?"

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「當生第二忉利天上。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "He will be born in the second Heaven of Truth.

source_sentence: 此閻浮提百歲，為忉利天上一日一夜，亦三十日為一月，十二月為一歲，彼忉利天壽千歲。」
translation: This Jambudvīpa is a hundred years old, a day and a night in the Heaven of the Thirty-three, a month in the Thirty-three, and a year in the Twelve months, and that Heaven of the Thirty-three has a lifespan of a thousand years."

source_sentence: 阿難復問：「於彼命終，當生何處？」
translation: Again, Ānanda asked, "Where will he be born when his life ends?"

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「當生第三炎摩天上。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "He'll be born on the third Yama Heaven.

source_sentence: 此閻浮提二百歲，為炎摩天一日一夜，亦三十日為一月，十二月為一歲，彼炎摩天上壽二千歲。」
translation: This Jambudvīpa is 200 years old, which is one day and one night in Yama Heaven, and 30 days are a month and 12 months are a year, and that Yama god lives 2,000 years."

source_sentence: 阿難又問：「於彼命終，當生何處？」
translation: Ānanda then asked, "Where will he be born when his life ends?"

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「當生第四兜率天上。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "You will be born on the fourth Tuṣita Heaven.

source_sentence: 此閻浮提四百歲，為彼天上一日一夜，亦三十日為一月，十二月為一歲，彼兜率天壽四千歲。」
translation: This Jambudvīpa is 400 years old, which is one day and one night in that heaven, and 30 days are a month and 12 months are a year in that Tuṣita Heaven, which has a lifespan of 4,000 years."

source_sentence: 阿難又問：「於彼命終，當生何處？」
translation: Ānanda then asked, "Where will he be born when his life ends?"

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「當生第五不憍樂天。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "He'll be born in the fifth heaven of no-conceit.

source_sentence: 此閻浮提八百歲，為第五天上一日一夜，亦三十日為一月，十二月為一歲，彼第五天壽八千歲。」
translation: This Jambudvīpa is 800 years old, a day and a night on the fifth heaven, and 30 days are a month, 12 months are a year, and that fifth heaven has a lifespan of 8,000 years."

source_sentence: 阿難又問：「於彼命終，當生何處？」
translation: Ānanda then asked, "Where will he be born when his life ends?"

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「當生第六化應聲天。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "You will be born in the sixth heaven of transformation and response.

source_sentence: 此閻浮提千六百歲，為第六天上一日一夜，亦三十日為一月，十二月為一歲，彼第六天壽萬六千歲。」
translation: This Jambudvīpa is 1,600 years old, which is one day and one night above the sixth heaven, and 30 days are a month and 12 months are a year, and that sixth heaven has a lifespan of 10,000 to 6,000 years."

source_sentence: 阿難又問：「於彼命終，復生何處？」
translation: Ānanda then asked, "Where will he be born again when his life ends?"

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「還生第五天上。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "He'll be reborn up in the fifth heaven.

source_sentence: 如是次第，至四天王天。
translation: In this order, he'll go up to the four heavenly kings.

source_sentence: 上下七返，生六欲天中，自恣受福，極天之壽，無有中夭。」
translation: He goes up and down seven times and is born among the six heavens of desire, where he enjoys self-indulgence and happiness and has a very long life span without ever dying in the middle of it."

source_sentence: 阿難又問：「六天壽盡，當生何處？」
translation: Ānanda then asked, "Where will I be born when the life span of the six heavens is up?"

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「當下閻浮提，生於人中，出家學道。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "It's time to descend to Jambudvīpa, be born among humans, leave home, and train on the path.

source_sentence: 緣前鳥時誦持四諦，心自開解，成辟支佛，一名曇摩，二名修曇摩。」
translation: When he recites and upholds the four truths, his mind is enlightened, and he becomes a pratyekabuddha, one called a dharma, and two called a sūtra."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「一切諸佛，及眾賢聖，天人品類，受福多少，皆由於法種其善因，致使其後各獲妙果。」
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "All buddhas, worthies and sages, gods and humans of various kinds, and the amount of merit they receive are all the result of planting good causes in the Dharma that cause each to attain marvelous results later."

source_sentence: 爾時阿難，及諸眾會，聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: It was then that Ānanda and the assembly heard what the Buddha taught, rejoiced, and approved.

source_sentence: （五九）鳥聞比丘法生天品第五十二(丹本為五十九)
translation: (59) Chapter 52 of the Discipline of Monks Who Hear the Buddha's Teaching Being Born in Heaven (Danben: 59)

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時佛在舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada's Park in Jeta's Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 爾時於林樹間，有一比丘，坐禪行道，食後經行，因爾誦經，音聲清雅妙好無比。
translation: At the time, there was a monk sitting in meditation and walking among the trees, and as he was walking through the sutras after eating, he recited a sutra that had a sound so elegant and beautiful that it was beyond compare.

source_sentence: 時有一鳥，敬愛其聲，飛在樹上，聽其音響。
translation: A bird that loved that sound flew up in a tree and listened to its music.

source_sentence: 時有獵師，以箭射殺，緣茲善心，即生第二忉利天中，父母膝上，忽然長大，如八歲兒，面貌端正，殊異光相，昞然無有倫匹。
translation: A hunter then shot it with an arrow, and because of this good intention, it was born in the second Heaven of Thirty-three, where his parents were on his knees. He suddenly grew up like an eight-year-old child with a correct face and a distinctive appearance that was unmatched in appearance.

source_sentence: 即自念言：「我以何福？
translation: He then thought to himself, "What good fortune have I done?

source_sentence: 得生此中？」
translation: Can I be born here?"

source_sentence: 天福果報，便識宿命，觀見故身，本是禽鳥，蒙彼比丘誦經福報，得生此中。
translation: As the result of that divine merit, he then realizes his past life and observes that his former body was originally a bird, and thanks to that monk's recitation of the sūtras, he's been born here.

source_sentence: 即持天華，詣閻浮提，到比丘所，禮敬問訊，以天華香，供散其上。
translation: He then carried a celestial flower to Jambudvīpa, went to the monk, paid his respects, exchanged greetings, and scattered an offering of celestial-flower incense on top of it.

source_sentence: 比丘問言：「汝是何神？」
translation: The monk asked, "What kind of god are you?"

source_sentence: 答言：「我本是鳥，愛尊音聲，來此聽經。
translation: He replied, "I was originally a bird who loved the sound of the venerable's voice and came here to listen to the sūtras.

source_sentence: 承為獵師所殺，因此善心，生忉利天。」
translation: I was killed by a hunter, and because of that good intention, I was born in the Heaven of Thirty-three."

source_sentence: 比丘歡喜，即命令坐，為其說法種種妙善，天人開解，得須陀洹果，歡喜踊躍，即還天上。
translation: Rejoicing, the monk ordered them to sit down and explained the Dharma to them in a variety of ways that were wonderful and good. The gods and humans were enlightened and attained the fruit of stream entry, so they rejoiced and rejoiced, and returned to heaven.

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「如來出世，饒益甚多，所說諸法，實為深妙。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "The Tathāgata's appearance in the world was so beneficial that the teachings he explained were really profound and subtle.

source_sentence: 乃至飛鳥，緣愛法聲，獲福無量，豈況於人信心堅固受持之者，所獲果報，難以為比。」
translation: Even a flying bird that takes delight in the sound of the Dharma obtains measureless merit, so why wouldn't a person who firmly believes and retains it obtain a result that's difficult to compare?"

source_sentence: 爾時阿難及諸大眾，聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: It was then that Ānanda and the rest of the crowd heard what the Buddha taught, rejoiced, and approved.

source_sentence: 賢愚經卷第十二
translation: Sutra of Bhadraśriputra, Vol. 12
